A quick refusal checklist before you sign anything during a swap flow
quickSteps: Separate sign-in, approve, and send in your head before you touch the button.
Treat gasless signing as potentially powerful, not automatically safe.
Refuse anything unclear, urgent, or coming from support chats or DMs.
Use an interaction wallet and keep your main holdings wallet isolated.
If you already signed and something feels wrong, disconnect, review permissions, and contain risk fast.

recoveryDecisionTree.title: If you already signed a suspicious message
recoveryDecisionTree.goal: Contain risk first, then remove standing permissions and reduce future exposure.

branches.if: You signed but did not connect further or approve anything
then: Disconnect the site from your wallet session.
Stop signing additional prompts, even if the page pushes you to continue.
Avoid keeping significant balances in the same interaction wallet until you are confident it is safe.

branches.if: You suspect approvals or permissions were set
then: Disconnect the site from your wallet session immediately.
Review token approvals and revoke anything you do not recognize.
Move remaining funds to a safer wallet if you are unsure about ongoing exposure.
Record transaction IDs, domains, timestamps, and the exact message context you saw.
Use official support channels only for the tools you used, and share public details only.
Do not accept help via DMs or viewing-session tools, and do not install unknown software.
Stop wallet actions on the current device and move to a clean environment.
Treat the incident as a device hygiene problem first, not a customer-support problem.
Rebuild your routine using an interaction wallet and isolate long-term holdings.

riskNotes: Gasless signing can still grant powerful intent. No gas does not mean no risk.
If you cannot explain why you are signing in one sentence, refuse.
Verification requests should not require urgency, repeated signing, or support-chat instructions.
Use an interaction wallet for dapps and swaps, and keep a separate storage wallet for holdings.
If you already signed and something feels wrong, disconnect first, then review and revoke approvals where applicable.
Never share seed phrases, private keys, or allow remote access for ‘help’ or ‘recovery’.
